title: Gesture navigation suddenly stopped working and I can't see my notifications
content:
My phone seems to be stuck in some kind of special mode and I don't know how to disable this.

Gesture navigation suddenly stopped working on my phone. It's still enabled but swiping from the sides does nothing. Instead there's a small back arrow button in the bottom-left corner of the screen (I'm not sure whether it was always there or not). I wasn't in the settings menu or anything so I'm not sure how it happened.

When I pull up the status bar there seem to be missing options and I cannot see my notifications or access the brightness slider. Interestingly, my phone still vibrates when I receive a new notification, but it does not appear in the status bar.

Shortcuts like double tapping the power button to open the camera also don't work.

When I try to open the developper options it says "Developper options are not available for this user", which is weird because I never set up any other account (I didn't even know you could do that).

Power saving mode is off
I tried rebooting and all it did was change the theme back to light them for some reason
I can't seem to be able to reboot in safe mode
When I plug in my phone to my laptop, the folder is completely empty

Here is a screenshot of my screen with the status bar. Notice that gesture navigation is enabled in the background.

Does anyone know what is going on with my phone?
